\def \articleTITLE{[Re] Exploring the Role of Grammar and Word Choice in Bias Toward African American English (AAE) in Hate Speech Classification}
\def \articleTYPE{Replication}
\def \articleDOMAIN{ML Reproducibility Challenge 2022}
\def \articleBIBLIOGRAPHY{bibliography.bib}
\def \articleYEAR{2023}
\def \reviewURL{https://openreview.net/forum?id=MjZVx7a0KX-}
\def \articleABSTRACT{This reproducibility study aims to validate a claim regarding the impact of swear words on hate speech classification of African American English (AAE) text. We replicated the experiments using BERT models and a word replacement strategy on the Chameleon testbed. Our results broadly support the claim, showing that censored text (without swear words) is less frequently classified as hate speech. However, the choice of word replacement dictionary significantly influenced the results.}
\def \replicationCITE{Camille Harris, Matan Halevy, Ayanna Howard, Amy Bruckman, and Diyi Yang. 2022. "Exploring the Role of Grammar and Word Choice in Bias Toward African American English (AAE) in Hate Speech Classification." In 2022 ACM Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency (FAccT '22).}
